author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 3. Sabbavagga
segments.en: 3. All

segments.pli: 31. Paṭhamasamugghātasappāyasutta
segments.en: 31. The Practice Conducive to Uprooting (1st)

segments.pli: “Sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, paṭipadaṃ desessāmi.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha.
segments.en: Listen …

segments.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā?
segments.en: And what is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhuṃ na maññati, cakkhusmiṃ na maññati, cakkhuto na maññati, cakkhuṃ meti na maññati.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant does not identify with the eye, does not identify in the eye, does not identify from the eye, and does not identify: ‘The eye is mine.’

segments.pli: Rūpe na maññati … pe …
segments.en: They don’t identify with sights …

segments.pli: cakkhuviññāṇaṃ na maññati, cakkhusamphassaṃ na maññati, yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
segments.en: eye consciousness … eye contact. And they don’t identify with the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact. They don’t identify in that, they don’t identify from that, and they don’t identify: ‘That is mine.’

segments.pli: Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṃ maññati, yato maññati, yaṃ meti maññati, tato taṃ hoti aññathā.
segments.en: For whatever you identify with, whatever you identify in, whatever you identify as, and whatever you identify as ‘mine’: that becomes something else.

segments.pli: Aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko bhavamevābhinandati … pe …
segments.en: The world is attached to being, taking pleasure only in being, yet it becomes something else.

segments.pli: jivhaṃ na maññati, jivhāya na maññati, jivhāto na maññati, jivhā meti na maññati.
segments.en: They don’t identify with the ear … nose … tongue …

segments.pli: Rase na maññati … pe …
jivhāviññāṇaṃ na maññati, jivhāsamphassaṃ na maññati.
Yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṃ maññati, yato maññati, yaṃ meti maññati, tato taṃ hoti aññathā.
Aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko bhavamevābhinandati … pe …
segments.en: body …

segments.pli: manaṃ na maññati, manasmiṃ na maññati, manato na maññati, mano meti na maññati.
segments.en: mind …

segments.pli: Dhamme na maññati … pe …
manoviññāṇaṃ na maññati, manosamphassaṃ na maññati.
Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
segments.en: They don’t identify with the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact. They don’t identify in that, they don’t identify from that, and they don’t identify: ‘That is mine.’

segments.pli: Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṃ maññati, yato maññati, yaṃ meti maññati, tato taṃ hoti aññathā.
segments.en: For whatever you identify with, whatever you identify in, whatever you identify as, and whatever you identify as ‘mine’: that becomes something else.

segments.pli: Aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko bhavamevābhinandati.
segments.en: The world is attached to being, taking pleasure only in being, yet it becomes something else.

segments.pli: Yāvatā, bhikkhave, khandhadhātuāyatanaṃ tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
segments.en: As far as the aggregates, elements, and sense fields extend, they don’t identify with that, they don’t identify in that, they don’t identify from that, and they don’t identify: ‘That is mine.’

segments.pli: So evaṃ amaññamāno na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
segments.en: Not identifying, they don’t grasp at anything in the world.

segments.pli: Anupādiyaṃ na paritassati. Aparitassaṃ paccattaññeva parinibbāyati.
segments.en: Not grasping, they’re not anxious. Not being anxious, they personally become extinguished.

segments.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā”ti.
segments.en: This is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice that’s conducive…

suttaplex.blurb: The way to uproot all conceivings is to not conceive in relation to the six sense fields.
